sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"做，执行，实施，完成"之意。
means: perform ： 指完成困难较大、较复杂的任务。较正式用词。
conduct和perform一样比较正式，二者意义相近，但conduct含指导、领导或监督等意味。
do ： 最普通常用词，指完成某项具体工作、任务，也指完成某种行为或动作。
execute ： 指需专门技术熟练技巧去完成某种复杂的任务或表演等，也指用行动把计划或打算付诸实施或执行某项命令。
fulfil ： 指履行和实现所许诺的、所期望或要求的事情，含最终完成的意味。

sentences.en: None of us care whether they do right or wrong, good or harm.
sentences.cn: 我们中没有人关心他们做的是对还是错, 是好还是坏。

sentences.en: He does nothing but eat and drink.
sentences.cn: 他除了吃喝之外, 什么也不做。

sentences.en: You've done a good job.
sentences.cn: 你做得挺不错。

sentences.en: Will you do me a favour?
sentences.cn: 你帮我一下忙好吗?

sentences.en: John has done a good turn to me.
sentences.cn: 约翰为我做了一件好事。

sentences.en: He is doing very well at school.
sentences.cn: 他在学校学习很好。

sentences.en: She does her lessons well.
sentences.cn: 她学习很好。

sentences.en: She is doing the room.
sentences.cn: 她正在整理房间。

sentences.en: I'm quite sure they were doing the same problem.
sentences.cn: 我敢肯定他们解决的是同一问题。

means.word_mean: 行过, 走过, 游览

sentences.en: We did the journey in six hours.
sentences.cn: 我们在六小时之内走完了这段旅程。

sentences.en: I did the travel.
sentences.cn: 我旅行去了。

sentences.en: Hard work does wonders.
sentences.cn: 努力工作会取得惊人的成就。

means.word_mean: 适合, 可用, 方便

sentences.en: This room will do me quite well.
sentences.cn: 这个房间对我很合适。

sentences.en: Will this spanner do you?
sentences.cn: 这个扳手你用着行吗?

sentences.en: That will do!
sentences.cn: 行了, 够了。

sentences.en: This small one will do.
sentences.cn: 这个小的就行了。

sentences.en: It would never do to neglect official obligations.
sentences.cn: 玩忽职守是绝对不行的。

sentences.en: Vegetables do well here.
sentences.cn: 这里蔬菜长势好。

sentences.en: The fruit trees are all doing well.
sentences.cn: 果树长得不错。

means.word_mean: 精心的工作；认真的操作
[主英国口语]诈骗，欺骗，花招；骗局；骗人的东西
[主英国、新西兰口语]宴会，(社交)聚会，庆祝会；社交活动；节目，演出
[口语]必须做到的事情，该做的事；规定，要求
[常用复数][英国口语]分配，份额；待遇

sentences.en: Do you know him?
sentences.cn: 你认识他吗?

sentences.en: I didn't think.
sentences.cn: 我没有想过。

sentences.en: Telling lies does not pay.
sentences.cn: 撒谎不值得。

sentences.en: What (did) he tell you?
sentences.cn: 他告诉了你什么事?

sentences.en: (Do you ) like it?
sentences.cn: (你)喜欢它吗?

sentences.en: Why (does she) not buy one?
sentences.cn: (她)为什么不买一个?

sentences.en: Does she have a bike?
sentences.cn: 她有自行车吗?

sentences.en: Sorry, I don't have any whisky.
sentences.cn: 对不起, 我没有威士忌。

sentences.en: Do you have time for a drink?
sentences.cn: 你有空喝一杯吗?</seg>

jx.jx_en_mean: be no business or concern of

lj.lj_ly: it's my decision—it's nothing to do with you.
lj.lj_ls: 这是我的决定——不关你的事。

lj.lj_ly: the problems are usually to do with family tension.
lj.lj_ls: 这些问题通常与家庭关系紧张有关。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)behave in a manner characteristic of (a specified person)
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)（在举止行为上）模仿（某人）

lj.lj_ly: he did a Garbo after his flop in the play.
lj.lj_ls: 他表演失败后就模仿嘉宝。

lj.lj_ly: look, just do one, will you!.

phrase.cizu_name: do one's head (或 nut in 或 do one's head)

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal)be extremely angry, worried, or agitated
jx.jx_cn_mean: (英，非正式)暴怒；极其担心；极其激动

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)do not use the word — to me

lj.lj_ly: “Don't morning me. Where the hell've you been all night?”.
lj.lj_ls: “别跟我说早安，你一晚上到底在哪？”。

lj.lj_ly: I have no knowledge of the political dos and don'ts.
lj.lj_ls: 我对政治上的规矩一无所知。

jx.jx_en_mean: make a profit out of; benefit from

lj.lj_ly: they're doing well out of scrap metal.
lj.lj_ls: 他们正在靠废金属赚钱。

jx.jx_en_mean: be connected with (someone or something) to the extent specified
jx.jx_cn_mean: 与（某人，某物）有多大关系

lj.lj_ly: John's got nothing to do with that terrible murder.
lj.lj_ls: 约翰和那场可怕的谋杀没有任何关系。

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit.)used to express the speaker's opinion that something contravenes custom, opinion, or propriety
jx.jx_cn_mean: (英)[用于表示说话人认为某事与习俗、舆论或礼节相悖]不合适的，不可行的

lj.lj_ly: in such a society it is not done to admit to taking religion seriously.
lj.lj_ls: 在这样一个社会里承认很重视宗教是行不通的。

entry.def: Do is used to form the negative of main verbs, by putting 'not' after 'do' and before the main verb in its infinitive form, that is the form without 'to'.
entry.tran: （在do之后、主动词的原形之前加 not，构成主动词的否定式）

example.ex: They don't want to work...
example.tran: 他们不想工作。

example.ex: I did not know Jamie had a knife...
example.tran: 我不知道杰米有一把刀。

entry.def: Do is used to form questions, by putting the subject after 'do' and before the main verb in its infinitive form, that is the form without 'to'.
entry.tran: （将主语置于do和主动词的原形之间，构成疑问句）

example.ex: Do you like music?...
example.tran: 你喜欢音乐吗？

example.ex: What did he say?...
example.tran: 他说了什么？

entry.def: Do is used in question tags.

example.ex: You know about Andy, don't you?...
example.tran: 你知道安迪的情况，是不是？

example.ex: I'm sure they had some of the same questions last year, didn't they?
example.tran: 我确定他们去年遇到过一些同样的问题，是不是？

entry.def: You use do when you are confirming or contradicting a statement containing 'do', or giving a negative or positive answer to a question.
entry.tran: （对含有do的陈述句或疑问句作肯定或否定回答）

example.ex: 'Did he think there was anything suspicious going on?' — 'Yes, he did.'...
example.tran: “他认为有可疑的事发生吗?”——“是的，他认为有。”

example.ex: 'Do you have a metal detector?' — 'No, I don't.'...
example.tran: “你有金属探测仪吗?”——“不，我没有。”

entry.def: Do is used with a negative to tell someone not to behave in a certain way.
entry.tran: （用在否定句中，表示不让某人做出某种举动）

example.ex: Don't be silly...
example.tran: 别犯傻了。

example.ex: Don't touch that!
example.tran: 别碰那个!

entry.def: Do is used to give emphasis to the main verb when there is no other auxiliary.
entry.tran: （在没有其他助动词时，用来强调主动词）

example.ex: Veronica, I do understand...
example.tran: 韦罗妮卡，我确实懂了。

example.ex: You did have a tape recorder with you.
example.tran: 你确实带了录音机。

entry.def: Do is used as a polite way of inviting or trying to persuade someone to do something.
entry.tran: （用以礼貌性地邀请或说服某人做某事）

example.ex: Do sit down...
example.tran: 请坐。

example.ex: Do help yourself to another drink.
example.tran: 再来一杯吧。

entry.def: Do can be used to refer back to another verb group when you are comparing or contrasting two things, or saying that they are the same.
entry.tran: （在进行对比、比较或说明两组事物相同时，用来代替前面的动词词组）

example.ex: I make more money than he does...
example.tran: 我挣钱比他多。

example.ex: One day she will walk out, just as her own mother did...
example.tran: 总有一天她会离家出走，就像她母亲那样。

entry.def: You use do after 'so' and 'nor' to say that the same statement is true for two people or groups.
entry.tran: （与 so 或 nor 连用，表示两人或两组事物的情况相同）

example.ex: You know that's true, and so do I...
example.tran: 你知道那是真的，我也知道。

example.ex: We don't forget that. Nor does he...
example.tran: 我们没有忘记那事，他也没有。

usage_note.note: Do is used as an auxiliary with the simple present tense. Did is used as an auxiliary with the simple past tense. In spoken English, negative forms of do are often shortened, for example do not is shortened to don't and did not is shortened to didn't.
usage_note.translation: do 是用于一般现在时的助动词，did 则是用于一般过去时的助动词。口语中，do 的否定式通常用缩合形式。例如，do not 略作 don't，did not 略作 didn't。

entry.def: When you do something, you take some action or perform an activity or task. Do is often used instead of a more specific verb, to talk about a common action involving a particular thing. For example you can say 'do your teeth' instead of 'brush your teeth'.
entry.tran: 做，干，进行(常用于代替某个具体的动词)

example.ex: I was trying to do some work...
example.tran: 我当时正想要干点活。

example.ex: After lunch Elizabeth and I did the washing up...
example.tran: 吃过午饭后，我和伊丽莎白洗了碗。

entry.def: Do can be used to stand for any verb group, or to refer back to another verb group, including one that was in a previous sentence.
entry.tran: （用来代替任何动词词组或前一个句子中的动词词组）

example.ex: What are you doing?...
example.tran: 你在干什么？

example.ex: So tell me what this molecule does that makes it special...
example.tran: 那么告诉我这个分子有何作用而使其与众不同。

entry.def: You can use do in a clause at the beginning of a sentence after words like 'what' and 'all', to give special emphasis to the information that comes at the end of the sentence.
entry.tran: （用于句首从句中 what，all等词之后，以强调句尾的信息）

example.ex: All she does is complain...
example.tran: 她只知道抱怨。

example.ex: What I should do is go and see her...
example.tran: 我应该去看她。

entry.def: If you do a particular thing with something, you use it in that particular way.

example.ex: I was allowed to do whatever I wanted with my life...
example.tran: 我可以自由支配自己的生活。

example.ex: What did he do with the thirty pounds?...
example.tran: 他用这30英镑干了什么？

entry.def: If you do something about a problem, you take action to try to solve it.

example.ex: They refuse to do anything about the real cause of crime: poverty...
example.tran: 他们拒绝采取措施解决引发犯罪的真正问题：贫穷。

example.ex: Well, what are you going to do about it?...
example.tran: 嗯，你打算怎么处理它呢？

entry.def: If an action or event does a particular thing, such as harm or good, it has that result or effect.
entry.tran: 造成，产生(好的或坏的结果或影响）

example.ex: A few bombs can do a lot of damage...
example.tran: 几枚炸弹就可以造成严重破坏。

example.ex: It'll do you good to take a rest...
example.tran: 休息一下对你有好处。

entry.def: You can use do to talk about the degree to which a person, action, or event affects or improves a particular situation.

example.ex: The current reforms will do much to create these conditions...
example.tran: 当前的改革对创造这些条件大有帮助。

example.ex: They did everything they could to help us...
example.tran: 他们竭尽所能来帮助我们。

entry.def: You can talk about what someone or something does to a person to mean that they have a very harmful effect on them.

example.ex: I saw what the liquor was doing to her...
example.tran: 我发现烈酒对她伤害很大。

example.ex: You overlook the pressure you're under and what it does to you.
example.tran: 你忽视了你所承受的压力及它带给你的后果。

entry.def: If you ask someone what they do, you want to know what their job or profession is.

example.ex: What does your father do?...
example.tran: 你父亲做什么工作？

example.ex: He knew what he wanted to do from the age of 14.
example.tran: 他14岁起就知道自己日后干什么了。

entry.def: If you are doing something, you are busy or active in some way, or have planned an activity for some time in the future.

example.ex: Are you doing anything tomorrow night?...
example.tran: 你明天晚上有计划吗？

example.ex: 'What are you doing for Christmas?' Ella asked. 'We're going to Aunt Molly's.'...
example.tran: “圣诞节你打算做什么？”埃拉问到。“我们打算去莫莉姨妈家。”

entry.def: If you say that someone or something does well or badly, you are talking about how successful or unsuccessful they are.

example.ex: Connie did well at school and graduated with honours...
example.tran: 康妮在学校表现很好，以优异的成绩毕业了。

example.ex: Out-of-town superstores are doing well...
example.tran: 市郊的超市经营良好。

entry.def: If a person or organization does a particular service or product, they provide that service or sell that product.

example.ex: They provide design services and do printing and packaging...
example.tran: 他们提供设计服务，还进行印刷和包装。

example.ex: They do a good range of herbal tea.
example.tran: 他们经营种类繁多的花草茶。

entry.def: You can use do when referring to the speed or rate that something or someone achieves or is able to achieve.

example.ex: They were doing 70 miles an hour.
example.tran: 他们的速度达到了每小时 70 英里。

example.ex: His catamaran will do 37 knots.
example.tran: 他的双体船的速度可以达到 37 节。

entry.def: If you do a subject, author, or book, you study them at school or college.

example.ex: I'd like to do maths at university.
example.tran: 我希望在大学里学数学。

example.ex: So you did 'Macbeth' in the first year?' — 'No, in the first year we did 'Julius Caesar'.'
example.tran: “那么你在第一年时学了《麦克白》?”——“不，第一年我们学的是《恺撒大帝》。”

entry.def: If you do a particular person, accent, or role, you imitate that person or accent, or act that role.

example.ex: Gina does accents extremely well.
example.tran: 吉娜模仿口音惟妙惟肖。

entry.def: You can use do to say that you are able or unable to behave in a particular way.

example.ex: 'Can't you be nicer to your sister?' — 'Nice? I don't do nice'.
example.tran: “难道你不能对你妹妹好一点吗？”——“对她好？我做不到。”

entry.def: If someone does drugs, they take illegal drugs.

example.ex: I don't do drugs.
example.tran: 我不吸毒。

example.ex: I saw him doing ecstasy in the toilets.
example.tran: 我看见他在洗手间吃摇头丸。

entry.def: If you say that something will do or will do you, you mean that there is enough of it or that it is of good enough quality to meet your requirements or to satisfy you.

example.ex: Anything to create a scene and attract attention will do...
example.tran: 任何能引起争吵、吸引注意力的事情都可以。

example.ex: We need a win — a draw won't do at all...
example.tran: 我们需要一场胜利，平局根本不行。

entry.def: If you say that you could do with something, you mean that you need it or would benefit from it.

example.ex: I could do with a cup of tea...
example.tran: 我需要一杯茶。

example.ex: The range could do with being extended.
example.tran: 范围需要扩展。

entry.def: You can ask someone what they did with something as another way of asking them where they put it.

example.ex: What did you do with that notebook?
example.tran: 你把那个笔记本放哪儿了？

entry.def: If you ask what someone or something is doing in a particular place, you are asking why they are there.

example.ex: 'Dr Campbell,' he said, clearly surprised. 'What are you doing here?'
example.tran: “坎贝尔医生，”他显然很惊讶地说道，“您怎么在这儿?”

example.ex: What was he doing in Hyde Park at that time of the morning?
example.tran: 那么一大早他在海德公园干什么？

entry.def: If you say that will do to a child, you are telling them to stop behaving in the way that they are.
entry.tran: (对小孩子所说的话)行啦，够啦

entry.def: If you say that one thing has something to do with or is something to do with another thing, you mean that the two things are connected or that the first thing is about the second thing.

example.ex: Mr Butterfield denies having anything to do with the episode...
example.tran: 巴特菲尔德先生否认和此事有关。

example.ex: They were shouting at each other. It was something to do with money...
example.tran: 他们在吵架，是为了钱的事。

usage_note.note: Do is used in a large number of expressions which are explained under other words in the dictionary. For example, the expression ‘easier said than done’ is explained at ‘easy’.
usage_note.translation: do 可以用在很多表达方式中，这些表达方式在本词典的其他词条中都给出了解释，例如，easier said than done就在easy词条下给出了解释。

entry.def: A do is a party, dinner party, or other social event.
entry.tran: 宴会;社交聚会;社交活动

example.ex: A friend of his is having a do in Stoke...
example.tran: 他的一位朋友正在斯托克举办宴会。

example.ex: They always have all-night dos there.
example.tran: 他们经常在那儿闹通宵。

entry.def: If someone tells you the dos and don'ts of a particular situation, they advise you what you should and should not do in that situation.

example.ex: Please advise me on the most suitable colour print film and some dos and don'ts.
example.tran: 请向我推荐最合适的彩色胶卷，并告诉我一些注意事项。

means.word_mean: 2. the syllable naming the first (tonic) note of any major scale in solmization
2. carry out or perform an action;

sentences.sentence: "John did the painting, the weeding, and he cleaned out the gutters"
"How is she doing in her new job?"
"How are you making out in graduate school?"

means.word_mean: 5. give rise to; cause to happen or occur, not always intentionally;
6. carry out or practice; as of jobs and professions;
7. be sufficient; be adequate, either in quality or quantity;

sentences.sentence: "A 'B' grade doesn't suffice to get me into medical school"

means.word_mean: 8. create or design, often in a certain way;

sentences.sentence: "I did this piece in wood to express my love for the forest"

means.word_mean: 9. behave in a certain manner; show a certain behavior; conduct or comport oneself;

sentences.sentence: "The dog acts ferocious, but he is really afraid of people"

means.word_mean: 10. spend time in prison or in a labor camp;

sentences.sentence: "We could do with a little more help around here"
"We did 6 miles on our hike every day"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English dōn, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch doen and German tun, from an Indo-European root shared by Greek tithēmi 'I place' and Latin facere 'make, do'
